subject: The Dancing Master
event: I can also confirm that we have cast Arya's dancing partner. Playing Syrio Forel, former First Sword of Braavos, will be MILTOS YEROMELOU. The London-based Yeromelou has done a lot of stage work, including Shakespearian turns at the Globe and with the Royal Shakespeare Company. He's played a hunchback, a panther, a clown, and a Beast (not Vincent), he's familiar with TinTin and Narnia and neanderthals, and he knows which end of the sword you stick 'em with. Some of that would have been used as hints, no doubt, but his name got out before I could start hinting. I hear that Miltos and Maisie are already sparring on Twitter. Just so.

comments.article: AHHH!!!!! HE LOOKS JUST LIKE I THOUGHT SYRIO SHOULD!!!!!!!!!!!
LOL! I was just going to say exactly the same thing! ^_^
I could never picture Syrio in my mind. I think he looks very good for the role though :)

comments.upictitle: Some Guy Named Paul's Comix: Group
comments.article:
Congrats, Miltos!

Can't help but notice his cap of tight black curls. Will he be sacrificing them for the team, or keeping that mat of dense black hair?
Miltos has tweeted that he was going in to makeup and prosthetics to discuss whether he'll be sacrificing those locks, or if a prosthetic skullcap will do the job.

John Malcovich.
From the first time I read Game of Thrones back in winter of 2005 (after learning of you from the TIME article in 2005 on a very hungover flight back from Vegas), I just so easily picture Malcovich with his "just so". Although I can't wait to see this guy bring those scenes to life.
Anyway.....Finish the Dance! Oh, and good picks on the HBO series!
comments.subject: Who I always pictured...

comments.article: Huh.  I never realized it, but that's exactly who I pictured, too.  I adore Malkovich so very much.  I can't wait to see how Miltos tackles the role. :)
comments.subject: Re: Who I always pictured...

comments.article: It looks like all three of the Stark kiddies are on Twitter :)
he looks like the perfect syrio- i kind of hope he keeps the curls. they fit the character.
much better with moustache
That's pretty much how I pictured him. Keep the beard.
The geek/nerd dial is up to 11.
comments.subject: OMG

comments.article: I think you misspelled his name. Google corrects me, that it's "Miltos YeroLEMou" not YeroMELou. Besides this he looks very good for the role.
Oh Yes, personally I think he looks more "Syrio" with the beard.
http://www.wheeloftime.ru/forum/index.php?action=gallery;sa=view;id=2602
comments.subject: Liked this one

comments.article:
Miltos Yeromelou!, the guy from Hubbub!.. oh fantastic, he moves so well. GoT is collecting one of The Best ensemble casts ever!..

I am having major geek squee!

damn... I just had to delete my post as it was full of spoilerish content. Can't ruin it for the newbies!

Awesome pick btw. Syrio is certainly one of my favorite characters.

I can't recall if/what movies i have seen him in.

But that face...wow, i think that face is just perfect.

A bit of toppic.

I read song of ice and fire several times.
I (and some of my friends) think, it's best tale ever written, and I read a lot.
I read it in polish, but I got impratient from waiting for so long for the next book, so I improved my english significantly, to be able to read samples on your website.
People all over the world can't wait for A DANCE WITH DRAGONS. I am one of these people.
Please, keep on working on the book.
I will surely buy a copy.

Best Regards
Nicolas, Poland.
comments.subject: Keep on working

comments.article:
I hear that Miltos and Maisie are already sparring on Twitter.

You gotta love those kids and their enthusiasm.

GRRM, I'm living in hope that it was you last evening at the westerosorg twitter site, who mentioned the role of Stannis Baratheon and added that actor Richard Armitage would be perfect for that role:)

HBO's subscribership and ASOIaF book sales would skyrocket if that scenario develops in the not too distant future. Perhaps it's far too early to even mention characters in a second series. Armitage is really a brilliant actor. Completed his professional training at LAMDA.
comments.subject: Twitter

comments.article:
Afraid Westeros.org (and the Twitter account, westerosorg) is me, not George. We're not an official site. Don't think George is on Twitter at all, actually.

I do think he's got a pretty good look for Stannis as described in the books, though. I vaguely recall some suggesting him for Bronn early on, but Stannis is a meatier role.
comments.subject: Re: Twitter

comments.article: Just so!  I bet their scenes are gonna be priceless.
This is great news! Syrio is one of my favorite characters and I'm glad he shall be well-represented!

He looks perfect! And I know it's just a face shot, but it seems as if his physical build is a good match too...more slender and elegant.

I am SO EXCITED for this!!! I loved the relationship between Syrio and Arya, it actually made me interested in fencing :)
Is he by any chance of Greek heritage? I searched him on the net, but found no information.
comments.subject: about the actor

comments.article: All of the casting so far I am very happy with. I told my friends the other day that the HBO series was going to be out next year and they said "NOOOO HBO WILL RUIN IT". But I reassured them that Mr. Martin will actually be involved and would let no such thing happen, and that he is not stupid with casting, clearly. This is all making me super happy.
Is it just me or is HBO going to have to spend lots of time uglying up most of its cast?
